intro: Asphodeliris stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved asphodel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period usually occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate floral display to its habitat. Asphodeliris stenantha is often used in rock gardens and dry landscapes due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
